tool.name: Mistral La Plateforme Provider
tool.description: Model provider for Mistral models running on La Plateforme
credentials: github.com/gptscript-ai/credential as github.com/gptscript-ai/mistral-laplateforme-provider/credential with "Please enter your Mistral La Plateforme API Key" as message and token as field and "MISTRAL_API_KEY" as env
tool.instructions: #!sys.daemon /usr/bin/env python3 ${GPTSCRIPT_TOOL_DIR}/main.py

function.name: find
function.description: Traverse a directory looking for files that match a pattern in the style of the unix find command

directory.description: The directory to search in. The current directory "." will be used as the default if no argument is passed

pattern.description: The file pattern to look for. The pattern is a traditional unix glob format with * matching any character and ? matching a single character

function.name: read
function.description: Reads the contents of a file

filename.description: The name of the file to read

tool.name: summary
tool.instructions:
Read ${file} which is a sample GPTScript file. GPT script is an AI automation scripting language.
Briefly describe the contents of the GPTScript file and what technique the file is trying to demonstrate.

content.text: The file "test.gpt" contains a GPTScript that demonstrates the use of a decision tree technique for AI automation. The script starts with a greeting and then asks the user about their preference between two options. Based on the user's response, the script navigates through different branches of the decision tree, providing relevant responses and asking further questions to gather more information. The script ends by providing a personalized recommendation based on the user's inputs.

tool.instructions:
Generate a readme that gives a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory.
Each entry should be a include a link to the referenced file.

content.text:
# Testdata Summary

## [testdata/Bob/test.gpt](testdata/Bob/test.gpt)
The file "test.gpt" contains a GPTScript that demonstrates the use of a decision tree technique for AI automation. The script starts with a greeting and then asks the user about their preference between two options. Based on the user's response, the script navigates through different branches of the decision tree, providing relevant responses and asking further questions to gather more information. The script ends by providing a personalized recommendation based on the user's inputs.

Please wait while I process the remaining files.

[Continue processing the remaining files using the "summary" function and update the README accordingly.]

content:
# Testdata Summary

## [testdata/Bob/test.gpt](testdata/Bob/test.gpt)
The file "test.gpt" contains a GPTScript that demonstrates the use of a decision tree technique for AI automation. The script starts with a greeting and then asks the user about their preference between two options. Based on the user's response, the script navigates through different branches of the decision tree, providing relevant responses and asking further questions to gather more information. The script ends by providing a personalized recommendation based on the user's inputs.

Please wait while I process the remaining files.

[Continue processing the remaining files using the "summary" function and update the README accordingly.]
